CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection allowed (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and currently living in GPE . She is the widow of Mr PERSON , who she alleges was unlawfully killed by a soldier on CARDINAL DATE at a checkpoint outside a gendarmerie headquarters on the road between GPE and Sason in south - east GPE . Her deceased husband had been a building contractor and a partner in ORG , which had its office in GPE . He was DATE at the time of his death .
CARDINAL . The circumstances in which the applicant ’s husband was killed on DATE are disputed .

CARDINAL . On DATE , PERSON , his brother , PERSON ( a building contractor ) , and his cousins , PERSON and PERSON ( both building workers ) , were travelling in a private car to check the construction of CARDINAL bridges in LOC of the province of Batman , south - east GPE . PERSON company had been awarded a contract by the ORG authorities for the construction of the bridges . PERSON Rıza Aytekin was at the wheel of the car .
CARDINAL . At TIME just as the vehicle had passed the ORG gendarmerie headquarters near GPE , a soldier on duty outside shouted to the vehicle to pull over and stop . PERSON , who was driving
relatively slowly due to the presence of speed ramps , pulled over or began to pull over to the right - hand side of the road in response to the soldier ’s order .

CARDINAL . Just as he stopped , the soldier , Private Tuncay Deniz , shot in the direction of the vehicle . The bullet went through the rear window of the vehicle , entered the back of PERSON head , came out through his forehead and exited the car through the windscreen . PERSON was killed instantly .

CARDINAL . When PERSON , PERSON and PERSON got out of the car , Private GPE raised his rifle as if to fire at them . However , when other soldiers came out of the gendarmerie headquarters and surrounded the car , Private Tuncay Deniz changed his mind and approached the car .
CARDINAL . All the persons in the car were unarmed and there was nothing in the vehicle except their personal belongings , the tools of their trade , a map and a calculator .

CARDINAL . Following the conduct of a post - mortem examination of the body and the issuance of a burial certificate PERSON , PERSON and PERSON had to procure a car from local villagers in order to transport the deceased ’s body back to PERSON . The applicant was living in GPE at the time of her husband ’s death .

CARDINAL . The applicant maintains that the above description of the circumstances surrounding the killing was confirmed by , inter alia , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON in the statements which they each gave to the public prosecutor shortly after the incident ( see paragraph DATE below ) . She also relies on the evidence of PERSON and his son GPE who were waiting to be picked up by her husband at a café QUANTITY down the road from the gendarmerie headquarters and who both gave statements to ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . Private GPE , a conscript who was DATE at the time , was performing his military service at the ORG gendarmerie headquarters in GPE in GPE , south - east GPE . He was on guard duty on DATE . Part of his functions was to check passing vehicles .

The autopsy report confirmed the entry and exit points of the bullet and that the brain of GPE had been shattered by the impact of the bullet . CARDINAL . On DATE Major PERSON , the GPE district commander , took statements from Private Tuncay Deniz as well as from PERSON who was also on duty on DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP The PERSON public prosecutor , who arrived at the scene shortly after the fatal shooting , immediately commenced an investigation into the incident ( file no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) . At TIME on DATE he took written statements from PERSON , PERSON and PERSON .

“ On DATE at TIME when the incident took place , the accused soldier , PERSON , was posted at the road checkpoint by his commander . This area has a critical importance in terms of security . CARDINAL ) , the ORG organised on CARDINAL DATE the future procedure for dealing with the case and to that end drew up a list of witnesses and documents . The court ordered that the evidence of the witnesses be taken by other domestic courts by letters rogatory and their statements forwarded to it for inclusion in the case file . CARDINAL . On DATE the court accepted the submissions of the prosecuting counsel that the applicant be acknowledged as an intervening party in the proceedings on account of the possibility that she may have suffered as a result of the offence committed by Private Tuncay Deniz . The court had regard in this respect to the petition which the applicant submitted to ORG on DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . She also declared that she filed a complaint against the defendant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG submitted to ORG at the latter ’s request a ballistics report on the CARDINAL spent bullets found at the scene of the incident . According to the report , the bullets had been fired from Private Tuncay Deniz ’s gun .

CARDINAL . On DATE Private Tuncay Deniz was convicted under Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) which governs causing death unintentionally , in conjunction with Article CARDINAL thereof ( using force in excess of that required by lawful self - defence ) and was sentenced to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . The court also ordered the defendant to pay the legal fees of the applicant as from the moment she became an intervening party in the proceedings . In its judgment ORG considered that :

“ According to the defendant ’s evidence and the preliminary statement of his friend PERSON , who was at the gendarmerie headquarters , the defendant signalled the approaching vehicle to stop ; when the vehicle failed to stop he gave a warning with his whistle and fired one round in the air . The vehicle still not having stopped he fired towards it without taking any particular aim when it was QUANTITY away . By doing so he caused the death of GPE . According to the passenger witnesses’ account they were not warned to stop in any way . However , if the driver was not warned to stop , it would have been illogical for him to have moved to the right . Under these circumstances the driver was warned CARDINAL way or another , even after he had passed . Nevertheless witness PERSON declared in his preliminary statement , and there is no reason for this statement not to be taken seriously , that he heard the sound of a whistle . The witness PERSON account that the defendant fired from a distance of QUANTITY without seeing anything at all was not confirmed by his father who was sitting in the same location .
The primary issue to be resolved is whether the defendant acted with the intention to kill in this incident ...

As it may be concluded from the content of the file , the defendant did not know the victim and the other passengers . The incident sketch in the file indicates that the firing distance was QUANTITY . In addition to the driver , there were QUANTITY persons seated in the back and CARDINAL other passenger in the front . Under these circumstances and at that distance it would not have been possible to identify the driver through the persons sitting in the back seat and take aim . Despite there being CARDINAL bullets in his rifle , the defendant fired CARDINAL single shot and despite that he still did not know whether this caused death . If his intention was to kill , he could have continued firing . Nevertheless there is no reason to ground a finding of murder . Having considered all these elements it is concluded that the defendant did not act with the intention to kill . Therefore , in due fairness , it is more appropriate to conclude that the intention was a wrongful assault .

Although the defendant was on duty he should have assumed that the individuals in the vehicle did not hear him and he could have fired CARDINAL shot in the air ; and having considered the fact that a serious situation such as an escape or apprehending someone in the act was not present and since an assumption must be made that he knew the specification of his weapon , he should have been more careful and should have fired his weapon in a way which would not have harmed the persons in the vehicle . As a result of failing to comply with these considerations he exceeded the limits of his duty . However , the reduction of his sentence based on this factor is to be minimal as a result of the reasons , importance and seriousness of the offence , and the gravity of the harm caused by the offence ... ”

CARDINAL . The applicant , through a domestic lawyer , Mr Oktay Bagatır , appealed to ORG on DATE against the judgment of ORG on the grounds that the accused should have been convicted of intentional homicide .

CARDINAL . According to the information provided by the Government at the hearing , the victim ’s brother , Mr PERSON , requested that as CARDINAL of the intervening parties in the domestic proceedings he be permitted to exercise separately his right to appeal against the judgment . ORG acceded to this request on CARDINAL DATE . Furthermore , the Batman public prosecutor appealed to ORG on DATE against the judgment of ORG on the ground that Private Tuncay Deniz should have been convicted of the more serious offence of wilful homicide as defined under LAW .
CARDINAL . The appeal is currently pending before ORG .

CARDINAL . Although the ORG submitted to ORG on DATE details of the investigation into the death of the applicant ’s husband as well as of the trial of the accused soldier before ORG and the state of the proceedings against him before ORG , the Commission did not in fact have the benefit of the full file when assessing the evidence surrounding the killing since the Government ’s submissions had been misplaced as a result of a clerical error .

CARDINAL . As a consequence of this error , the Commission based its assessment of the case on the following official documents only : the incident report prepared by Major PERSON ; the sketch map of the incident drawn by hand by PERSON ; the post - mortem and autopsy report prepared by the medical examiner ; statements taken by PERSON PERSON Eryılmaz on DATE from Private GPE and PERSON ; statements taken by ORG on DATE from Private Tuncay Deniz , PERSON , Expert Sergeant GPE and PERSON ( see paragraphs CARDINAL , DATE and DATE above ) .

The ORG also had regard to the following : CARDINAL statements of PERSON , CARDINAL of which had been taken by ORG ; a statement of the applicant taken by ORG on DATE ; an expert statement dated DATE of Dr PERSON , a consultant pathologist for ORG .

CARDINAL . The ORG accepted firstly that there were speed ramps in place outside the gendarmerie headquarters which would have made it difficult and unlikely that the applicant ’s husband could have driven the car at speed through the checkpoint .

CARDINAL . Secondly , no explanation was offered as to why the deceased would have driven recklessly through the checkpoint causing the soldier to jump to safety . For these reasons , the ORG found the soldier ’s account of being at risk to be unconvincing .

CARDINAL . Thirdly , while the Commission was unable to determine on the evidence whether the car was stationary or was still moving when the gendarme opened fire , it found it established that Private Tuncay Deniz signalled the car to stop . However , in its view there was insufficient material to conclude that he had fired a warning shot in the air as alleged since no ballistics report had been submitted .

CARDINAL . Fourthly , the Commission considered that there must be a very strong inference either that Private Tuncay Deniz aimed into the back of the car at the driver or fired so quickly as to render his aim inaccurate .

CARDINAL . In view of the above findings the ORG concluded that the car driven by the applicant ’s husband was driven slowly up to and through the checkpoint , that the soldier signalled it to stop and that very shortly afterwards he opened fire intending to stop the car , either aiming at the driver or failing to take proper aim .

CARDINAL . In the absence of detailed submissions on domestic law and practice , the ORG , like the ORG , has had regard to the relevant provisions and submissions made in the context of previous cases involving the respondent Government and the applicant ’s representatives .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of LAW provides as follows :
“ All acts or decisions of the authorities are subject to judicial review ...
The authorities shall be liable to make reparation for all damage caused by their acts or measures . ”

CARDINAL . This provision is not subject to any restrictions even in a state of emergency or war . The latter requirement of the provision does not necessarily require proof of the existence of any fault on the part of the authorities , whose liability is of an absolute , objective nature , based on the theory of “ social risk ” . Thus the authorities may indemnify people who have suffered damage from acts committed by unknown or terrorist authors when the ORG may be said to have failed in its duty to maintain public order and safety , or in its duty to safeguard individual life and property .
CARDINAL . The principle of administrative liability is reflected in the additional section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL of DATE on the state of emergency , which provides :
“ ... actions for compensation in relation to the exercise of powers conferred by this PERSON are to be brought against the authorities before the administrative courts . ”

CARDINAL . LAW contains provisions dealing with unintentional homicide ( Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL ) , inadvertent and negligent homicide ( Article CARDINAL ) , intentional homicide ( Article CARDINAL ) and murder ( Article CARDINAL ) . Articles DATE and CARDINAL of the Criminal Code address the commission of offences carried out inter alia in excess of a duty .

CARDINAL . According to Article CARDINAL any person who intentionally kills another shall be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of CARDINAL to thirty years . According to LAW , the death penalty may be imposed in cases of , inter alia , premeditated murder . Under LAW , where death results from an act of violence but it was not the intention of the offender to kill his victim , a sentence of CARDINAL years’ imprisonment shall be imposed on the offender . Where death results from an act of carelessness , negligence or inexperience on the part of the offender in breach of a law , orders or regulations , LAW stipulates that the guilty party shall be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of DATE and to a substantial fine .

CARDINAL . According to LAW , a person shall not be punished for committing an act which was carried out in pursuance of a law or on the orders of a competent authority or where the person was obliged to commit the act in immediate necessity to repel an unjustified assault against his own or another ’s person or chastity or in order to save his life or the life of another from an immediate and grave personal danger for which he was not responsible and the commission of the act was the only way in which the danger could be avoided . Article DATE qualifies the provisions of Article CARDINAL in stipulating that where the person in committing the act exceeds the limits of a duty prescribed by law or by the competent authority or exceeds the exigencies of the situation , that person shall be sentenced to a minimum term of imprisonment of DATE if the punishment in respect of the act is the death penalty , and to a minimum term of imprisonment of DATE if the punishment in respect of the act is life imprisonment .

CARDINAL . Pursuant to section PERSON ) of PERSON no . CARDINAL on the state of emergency , when a state of emergency has been proclaimed the security forces , special forces on duty and members of the armed forces when carrying out their duties are empowered to use their weapons in situations where recourse to them is considered justified under law . According to section CARDINAL ) , when a state of emergency has been declared under section CARDINAL(b ) of the PERSON , members of the security forces when on duty may without hesitation open fire directly on a person who fails to heed their orders to surrender , returns fire or when they are obliged to act in self - defence .

CARDINAL . For all such offences complaints may be lodged , pursuant to ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW , with the public prosecutor or the local administrative authorities . The public prosecutor and the police have a duty to investigate crimes reported to them , the former deciding whether a prosecution should be initiated , pursuant to LAW . A complainant may appeal against the decision of the public prosecutor not to institute criminal proceedings ( Article CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . If the suspected authors of the impugned acts are military personnel , they may also be prosecuted for causing extensive damage , endangering human lives or damaging property , if they have not followed orders in conformity with Articles DATE and CARDINAL of the Military Code . Proceedings in these circumstances may be initiated by the persons concerned ( non - military ) before the competent authority under LAW , or before the suspected person ’s hierarchical superior ( sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL on the constitution and the procedure of military courts ) .

CARDINAL . If the alleged author of a crime is a ORG official or civil servant , which includes members of the security forces , permission to prosecute must be obtained from local administrative councils ( ORG of ORG ) which carry out a preliminary investigation ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of Decree no . CARDINAL ) . The local council decisions may be appealed to ORG ; a refusal to prosecute is subject to an automatic appeal of this kind .

CARDINAL . Any illegal act by civil servants , be it a crime or a tort , which causes material or moral damage may be the subject of a claim for compensation before the ordinary civil courts . Pursuant to Article CARDINAL of ORG , an injured person may file a complaint for compensation against an alleged perpetrator who has caused him or her damage in an unlawful manner whether wilfully , negligently or imprudently . Pecuniary loss may be compensated by the civil courts pursuant to LAW and non - pecuniary or moral damages may be awarded under LAW .

CARDINAL . Proceedings against the authorities may be brought before the administrative courts , whose procedure is written . A plaintiff has DATE in which to lodge a complaint against the authorities in respect of an impugned act and thereafter DATE in which to bring the complaint before the administrative courts .

CARDINAL . LAW also makes provision to allow a person to constitute himself or herself a civil party in respect of pecuniary loss resulting from the commission of an offence . According to LAW , any person injured by a crime may , at any time during an investigation , by means of a complaint declare himself or herself a civil party and request compensation for damage which is the direct result of the accused ’s criminal act . This remedy is only available to direct victims and can not be exercised on behalf of a deceased victim . The remedy is not applicable if the accused is acquitted of the offence . The acquisition of civil party status is dependent on the fact that that party has not sought compensation from the civil courts in respect of the damage resulting from the offence .
CARDINAL . The applicant points to certain legal provisions which in themselves weaken the protection of the individual which might otherwise have been afforded by the above general scheme .
CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL to CARDINAL of the LAW provide for fundamental limitations on constitutional safeguards .

CARDINAL . Provisional LAW provides that there can be no allegation of unconstitutionality in respect of measures taken under laws or decrees having the force of law and enacted between CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE . That includes LAW no . CARDINAL on the state of emergency of CARDINAL DATE , under which decrees have been issued which are immune from judicial challenge .

CARDINAL . Extensive powers have been granted to the regional governor of the state of emergency by such decrees , especially Decree no . CARDINAL , as amended by Decrees nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL , and Decree no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . Decree no . CARDINAL modifies the application of PERSON no . CARDINAL of DATE on the prevention of terrorism in those areas which are subject to the state of emergency , with the effect that the decision to prosecute members of the security forces is removed from the public prosecutor and conferred on local administrative councils .
